metadata.description: Unified master data for Chainstack nodes availability & configurations

global.description: Global Node is a service providing a load-balanced node that routes requests to the closest available location for a specific protocol, based on the caller's location. This ensures efficient service access for users worldwide by routing requests in an optimized manner.

dedicated.description: Node exclusively deployed for a particular customer with dedicated compute resources.

trader.description: A Trader Node is a service providing a regional-based endpoints which are tightly bound to particular location.

full.description: Stores full blockchain data with limitations on past queryable blocks.

archive.description: Stores full blockchain data and archive of historical states, allowing queries from genesis.

Solana.full_mode_query_limit: Up to the first block available on the node. ~1.5 days worth.

TON.full_mode_query_limit: Both v2 and v3 (indexer) are supported
TON.additional_notes: No difference between full and archive nodes in data availability or pricing

Fantom.full_mode_query_limit: No difference between full and archive
Fantom.additional_notes: Sonic client does not have automatic state pruning, no difference between full and archive nodes

Gnosis Chain.full_mode_query_limit: 1,024 MB of historical states. ~10 hours worth of immediately previous blocks.

Oasis Sapphire.full_mode_query_limit: Full node stores full blockchain data and archive from genesis

Polygon zkEVM.full_mode_query_limit: A full node currently stores the full blockchain data and an archive of historical states starting from the chain genesis.
